Name: All About Terre Haute Indiana
Description:
Limited Edition promotional board game from 1982 about the city of Terre Haute.
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list. 
The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations and streets are real businesses in Terre Haute, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area.

Name: Era of Kingdoms: Inquisition
Description:
Two new paths to victory await in the first expansion to Era of Kingdoms. Generate Research and Religious Influence tokens to spend on powerful upgrades and new ways to influence other Kingdoms. Choose your religious beliefs bonuses, add followers to your Kingdom, and send heretics to your enemies' land. Make use of innovative thinking to gain advantages in resource yield, governance, military tactics, and architecture. Loads of new events and interactions while keeping the core of the game the same!

—description from the designer

Name: All About Asheville
Description:
Limited Edition promotional board game from 1982 about the city of Asheville, NC.
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list. 
The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations and streets are real businesses in Asheville, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area.

Name: All About Nashville Tennessee
Description:
Limited Edition promotional board game from 1982 about the city of Nashville.
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list. 
The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations and streets are real businesses in Nashville, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area.

Name: Sooth Sayer: A Character Expansion for Five Leagues from the Borderland
Description:
This expansion pack adds the Sooth Sayer: A magic user capable of predicting the future.

Sooth Sayers can be added to any war band, whether you are just starting a campaign or far along your adventure.

Included are character creation and campaign notes, new items to bolster your magical recruit and abilities that are beneficial both on and off the battle field.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Five Leagues From the Borderland

Name: Expansive Universe
Description:
A galaxy of adventures awaits in Expansive Universe.

This is a sandbox adventure card game that has many paths to victory: explore your planet, attempt missions on enemy planets, dominate the galactic core with your armada, or engage in ground combat.  Assemble your crew, and build your fleet.  Unlimited science fiction stories are contained in Expansive Universe.

Each player chooses a faction.  Each faction starts with a planet, a spaceship, a location, and the alpha character.  The rest of the cards for each faction that is being played get shuffled into the main deck.  Every turn, cards from the main deck are auctioned and come right into play when bought.  Players can choose whether they want to build a fleet of ships, a crew of space explorers, or maximize gold production.

The sandbox style card game features a point system, so players can get points by exploring, doing missions, winning space battles, winning ground combat, or controlling the galactic core.  Every game is different.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mitsudomoe
Description:
OVERVIEW

Lay stepping stones (rings) for your trio (balls) to walk and vault their way to the opposite corner. Inconvenience your opponents by covering their rings with yours, and by relocating their balls as you spring over them!

GOAL

Get all 3 of your balls to your goal spaces opposite your starting corner, or be the last player remaining in the game.

EQUIPMENT

1 gameboard depicting a 5 × 5 grid, 12 balls (3 each in black, white, red, yellow), 32 rings (8 each in black, white, red, yellow), carrying case.

GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW

On your turn you place or move a ring of your colour, and jump with one of your balls over other balls, relocating the jumpee balls somewhere else.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ramasjang
Description:
Adventure game, where you have to act fasts, smart and avoid beeing eaten!

DR Ramasjang is the land, where children kan meet all the famous figures like Bruno and Monster. Ramasjang is never boring nor standing still. I the Ramasjang game you'll arrive in the land of Ramasjang and help the inhabitants finding things from the well know TV shows, while you flash through secrets portals.

Each player starts by choosing a player board and three different random tokens. These are the secret things you need to find to win the game.

The youngest player starts the game, and each player takes turn rolling the dice moving around the Ramasjang Island. Each stop, has a secret token that can be turned. If the tokens mach one of the three tokens on the player board, the player may keep it, if not - it is placed on the board again. When all three tokens are collected, you must travel to the center of the Island to win.

Flash spots on the board provide secret passages to other flash spots, and if you roll a 6 - you may move the monster and catch and eat another player or block the way! Any player who's taken by the monster, must return to his starting area of the board and wait one turn before entering the island again.

Name: Le Manipulateur
Description:
Abstract connection game played on a 17x17 board. Each player has a "Manipulator" piece which moves by making a rook move, then dropping a pawn on the square arrived on, then making a second rook move at right angles to the first.

On a player's turn they either move their Manipulator in the manner described, or they capture one or more opposing pawns by making a jump or series of jumps with one of their own pawns in a manner similar to checkers. Pawns cannot move except to capture and the Manipulators cannot capture.

A player wins when their pawns either form an unbroken chain from one side of the board to the other, or have trapped the opposing Manipulator so that it cannot move.

Winner of the "Pion d'Or 1983" award from "Jeux & Stratégie" magazine.
A winner of the 1983 Concours International de CrÃ©ateurs de Jeux de SociÃ©tÃ©.

Name: Escape: Queenie Box
Description:
All Queenies that were released after the Escape Big Box 2nd Edition in one convenient box!

    11 â€“ The Cursed Gems
    12 â€“ The Slide
    13 â€“ The Map
    14 â€“ The Wishing Well
    15 â€“ New Quests
    16 â€“ New Traps


With this and the Big Box, players will have everything that is available for Escape.

The Escape Queenie Box is also a great addition for players who only own the base game and want new modules to add to their adventures.

Queenie 11: The Cursed Gems is already included in the Big Box, but is such a popular Queenie that we wanted to include it for all players to enjoy.

Name: Flank the Tiger
Description:
Flank the Tiger a World War II game with Tanks, lots of TANKS.

There are a lot of rule sets which more accurately capture the combined arms nature of World War II combat, but these rules do not pretend to be one of them.

This game attempts to be realistic-ish in what it represents, swirling tank battles. 
 But the lack of infantry, artillery, engineering, and air power gives it more of an arcade feel than that of an actual battlefield.

The only intent with this rule set is to give players a chance to use their tank models in a fast and fun game where you get to blow stuff up and maybe even enjoy getting your own stuff blown up.

Flank the Tiger includes vehicle data for 142 vehicles (Germany, USSR, USA and UK) and has pre-filled vehicle sheets for 61 select vehicles (18 Germans, 17 Russians, 12 American, and 14 British).

Name: Pitter-Patter
Description:
Pitter-Patter is a dexterity roll and draw area control game for 2-4 players. In the game players are raindrops having a war over puddles on the window pane. Players roll or toss dice onto a paper, drawing puddle around the die where it lands, and trying to push and take control over opponents puddles.

In the files section there are rules for the game. Other than rules, you need 5 dice per player in one color, a piece of paper and a pencil.

—description from the publisher

Name: Herb Merchant (薬草ひとついかがですか？)
Description: A simple card game where you play as a JRPG medical herb merchant, selling herbs to adventurers and making exact change.  Coins weigh down adventurers, so try to use as few possible when making change to increase your reputation.  Special cards provide useful one-use advantages.  The player with the most gold at the end of the game wins!

Name: Street Masters: Chian and Dan
Description:
Two winners of a contest had their likenesses immortalized into a pair of Ally/Rival cards for Street Masters.

These cards were available as promotions at GenCon 2019 and as a digital print and play.

Name: Armoured Assault
Description:
Armoured Assault book provides gamers with additional vehicles not featured in other Great Escape Games publications.

It also contains two new scenarios which allow gamers to field more than on vehicle alongside their infantry platoons on multiple vehicles on there own.

The majority of the vehicles in the book are from the later part of World War Two. These are vehicles that weren't featured in the Orders of Battle given in the rule book or Operation Bagration source book. 
Also are included a few vehicles not in the field in large numbers for diversity.

Name: Operation Bagration: To the Fall of the Reich
Description:
Operation Bagration to the Fall of the Reich is an Eastern Front Supplement (June 1944 to May 1945) for Rules of Engagement

It includes Orders of Battle for the following forces:

     Soviet Rifle, Motorized, Reduced Strength and Partisan platoons.
     German Volkssturm, Ruckkampfer and Eastern Waffen SS platoons
     Finns, Romanians, Hungarians and Slovaks

Name: Cardtropolis
Description:
Super Heroes gather, the clock has struck midnight and Cardtropolis is under attack! Led by fearsome bosses like Penny 2020, Sister Blister, and The Machine, these Super-Villains along with their loyal Minions are taking over midtown. The citizens' hopes rest with you. Your task is to use Super Heroes, Sidekicks, and Specials to capture all of the Super-Villains, Minions, and a Crook or two along the way. The safety of Cardtropolis is in your hands!

This turn-based card game can be played as free-for-all between opposing players or in team vs. team mode where players cooperate with their teammate to outwit and outplay the other team.

Each turn you must decide to capture a weak Super Villain immediately with a low power Superhero or wait for the right card to do a Team-Up or a Power-Up play and capture a more powerful Super Villain.

But keep an eye on your captured Super-Villains because players can use a Special and steal them away!

Name: Four Word Thinking
Description:
In this frenetic word game, 2 to 6 players race to pair hexagonal tiles bearing two-letter combinations and claim four-letter words as quickly as possible. The domino style of play means every new tile changes the available letters, so players must think FA-ST. Packaged in a distinctive hexagonal box, this fast-paced game takes seconds to learn, minutes to play, and provides endless hours of fun for word-game enthusiasts of all ages.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sock Race
Description:
The object of the game is to be the first player across the finish line with the most pairs of socks. A “clothesline” to hang your socks, special play socks, Sock Monkey cards, Wash Day cards, Darn cards and a Sock Hop all guide you through collecting socks, losing your socks, and matching them through cute illustrations and everyday, relatable ideas.

Players move around the Sock Track (game board) and follow the instructions on each square.  The player may pick socks from the Sock Drawer, win locks from the Sock Pile, or lose socks to Redhand the Raccoon or the Sock Monkey.  If the player crosses the finish line (one lap around the Sock Track) with the required number of socks, they win!

A game of two players will run between 20-30 minutes, 4-6 players complete in just under an hour.

Name: Tower Enforcer
Description:
Take the role of a Dungeon Hunter with unique stats and abilities. Battle Towers of increasingly difficult monsters. Work your way up to the Tower Boss and claim the Legendary Items to help you defeat all 7 Towers to gain ultimate victory.

Use your selected Dungeon Hunter and Battle the Tower of your choosing with the Battle Deck. The battle deck consists of Attack Cards and Defense cards. These cards are added to your Dungeon Hunters Corresponding Base Stats. After drawing 5 battle cards the battle begins. Select one of the 7 Towers to Battle.

Play the battle card of your choice down within the energy requirements. A card can only be played if you have the energy equal to the card value. Energy is spent when you play an Attack card. Energy can be gained by playing defense card. If you receive damage when playing a defense card that damage is also dealt to your energy.

Your overall attack towards the monster is your base attack stat plus the attack card you have played. Same for your defense, it is the defense card and your Base Defense stat added together. If your overall attack is higher than the monsters overall attack damage is dealt to the monster. But if the monster has a higher attacking card the damage is dealt to your Dungeon Hunters Health Points. Once the monster's health is brought down to 0 the tower shifts down and you battle the next monster.

Every two monsters beaten the Tower rewards you with a random item that can help you defeat the Tower easier. But while the Tower can help you every 5 turns the Tower throws an Event at you. Events can be good helping you gain health, items or even boost your stats. But just as good as they can be they can also be bad. Removing items, losing health, or even doubling the Monsters stats.

Only after defeating all the monsters and the Tower Boss can you gain a Legendary item to help you Battle other towers. Defeating all 7 Tower will grant you victory!

—description from the publisher

Name: Fistful of Lead: Bigger Battles!
Description:
What Fistful of Lead Core Rules are to skirmish level wargaming, Bigger Battles is for large scale wargaming.

The beloved Fistful of Lead card mechanics are still there to drive the action, but now each card controls a unit, rather than one soldier.  
How many units, you ask?  How many cards are in a deck, my friend?  Yep.  You can play 52 units on a table!  That is a bigger battle.

In most games, each player can control up to 5-6 units and their Commanders and Heroes without much trouble.  
Games can have up to 8 players without slowing down the game.
 Now, you can dig out all your old miniatures gathering dust and have a game ready to go in a few minutes.

Experienced wargamers and new players alike will enjoy this game.  
Bigger Battles is perfect for convention games and just one-on-one contests.

—description from the publisher

Name: Royalty: King and Queen Collide
Description:
Two rulers advance on the battlefield with their retinue of greatest warriors. Each of them prepared for a duel the likes of which none have ever seen. From Chessand the great White Queen marches forth, ready to decimate his brutish opponent with her superior cunning and strategy, while the all-powerful warrior-king The Red King of Hearts advances from Carda with his superior defenses and firepower. Only one shall leave this battlefield alive, but who will it be?

Royalty is a two-player strategy dice game. Use your four dice and the varied abilities of your Heroes to outwit and strongarm you opponent and claim victory! Use these dice to move and activate the abilities of your three wildly different Heroes or go for broke and use them to activate the difficult but powerful abilities of your Royal leader! Defeat your opponent with strategic movements or burst through their forces with cunning force!

Name: Heads or Tails: The Monster Dating Game
Description:
Looking for a new hot date and don't mind them having fangs or claws?

Heads or Tails is a card game in which you’re a bachelor on a dating game show, trying to win a smoking hot monster date! This game encourages improv comedy, laughing, and being social.

The game is played with a player selected as the game show Host, another as the Bachelor, and the rest as contestants!

Each contestant will draw a random Monster card and Personality card. The Bachelor will ask a question, which will be answered by each Monster in clockwise turn order. The Host is encouraged to play up the game and mediate, but it's not required.

Monsters use their Personality cards to add to the humor, while trying to answer questions cleverly as the monster they are. At the end of three rounds, the Bachelor must guess each monsters identity. For each correct guess, the Bachelor gets a point. If the Bachelor guesses incorrectly, than the Monster gets the point unless the Host determines the Monster gave too vague of answers. Additionally, the Bachelor will reward 3 points to their favorite Monster, which can be determined for any reason they see fit (which could also mean, monsters purposely give away their identity, going "all in" for the 3 points.

The game continues, passing the roles of Host and Bachelor clockwise until every player has gotten to play those roles.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins!


    Features & Benefits *


• Over 1,000 combinations of cards, leading to every experience being a different one! • The entire game in one box, making it extremely easy to carry and play anywhere, any time! • 32 unique monster cards with listed traits to help inform players. • 32 unique personality cards that will encourage comedic results! • 3 prompt cards to help those who struggle with creating questions on their own. • 1 monster reference card to help those that struggle with memorization. • Quick rule card and easy rules to learn, so you can get to playing immediately and never have to read the rulebook again!

—description from the designer

Name: Roll Low
Description:
A dice game where players attempt to roll one of several combinations using 7 dice in as few attempts as possible. Scoring is determined by how many rolls a player took to obtain a specified combination.

Roll Low is similar to Yahtzee but has unlimited rolls and allows 1 reattempt with a two point penalty. Roll low has two different scoresheets with different prescribed combinations.

At the start of a players turn, a player rolls 7 dice and determines if a combo can be scored. If so, the player will write a 1 on the scoresheet for the available combination. If a combination can’t be scored, then the player will hold dice of their choosing and reroll the remainder noting the number of rolls that has passed until a combination can be scored.

—user summary

Name: Ghost Hunters!: A 3-Dimensional Game Book
Description:
Ghost Hunters! is a classical 'roll/spin and move' game, but built in a 3D pop-up book:

You are Ghost Hunters visiting a mysterious castle to hunt and collect ghosts. Ghosts are collected by visiting the squares they live on. Traps can set you back on your task to collect the most ghosts.

There are ghosts of value 1 and 2 plus the super ghost with value 10. Catching the super ghost ends the game. The hunter with the most ghosts (i.e. sum of the collected ghosts values) wins.

At some places, you have multiple options where to go.

Name: Shitty Mechs
Description:
A Roll & Write, for 3 - 6 players, about designing and fighting your very own (sh*tty) mechs.

Each player draws their very own Mech before rolling dice to power it up and throw down with friends.  All that's needed is two dice per player, a pen or pencil each and a copy of the Mech Design Document.

Also available in the Files Section, if you want something more family friendly  - Rubbish Mechs ;it's the exact same game, just without the big and clever swearing - you can even use the same Mech Design Document!

Name: The Book of Roman Pop-Up Board Games
Description:
Four spin/roll and move games in one book:

Gladiators, Chariot Race, Escape From Pompeii, and Race for the Throne

Name: Point Man: WWII Skirmish Rules
Description:
Point Man is a set of skirmish rules covering the period 1939-1945. These rules are easy to learn and the basics can be taught in as little as five minutes to a novice player.

As easy as they are they feature a movement - fire system that simulates simultaneous movement without record keeping or any of the other typical problems with that sort of system.

The rules also feature detailed weapons charts that allow for the feel of the individual figure. Rules include both aimed and area fire, indirect fire, command and control, armored fighting vehicles, aircraft, hand to hand combat, friendly fire, paratroops, naval landings, field fortifications and combat engineering.

Designed for 20mm minis but can be adjusted to other scales.

Sequence of Play: 
Each turn consists of a undetermined
number of phases. 
Each phase consists of an Initiative Sub-
Phase, a Declaration Sub-Phase and an Action Sub-Phase

—description from the publisher

Name: Armor Heavy Team: Tacforce 2.0 – Armored Warfare 1950-2010
Description:
Armor Heavy Team is an official updating and expansion of the TacForce rules published by GDW/GHQ and done with the permission of GHQ.

They cover tactical combat from 1950 to 2015. 
It is the most detailed set of rules ever written for the open market while still remaining playable.

They are broken down into three levels depending on the amount of detail the GM and players wish.

The rules include sections for

     Urban Combat,
     Combat Engineering,
     Command Control and Communication,
     Maintenance,
     Night Operations,
     Nuclear,
     Biological and Chemical
     and about every other kind of warfare that we have seen or will see.


While the base game only comes with the classic cold war era vehicles, additional vehicle sets are available.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Other Road To Arnhem
Description:
A solo tactical game about the battles and struggles that the 1st Airborne division faced during the first few days of the drops and landings around the Arnhem/Oosterbeek area.

You play as the British in this chit pull, paragraph driven game, the enemy may not be placed on the map until you spot them, or they spot you.

Before the game begins there are decisions to make. Which attached units do you want to add and how much additional ammo do you want to take. These come at a cost of a time/VP deduction. 
Flip a chit and obey the instructions, chits allow platoons or groups to be activated, as well as passing of time, mortar actions, minefields and wire activations, random events etc. When one of your platoons is activated you give the platoon one of four orders, Hold, Advance, Assault or Recce. These orders allow your sections to make an action. As well as the usual combat,  movement and morale test other actions include spotting and special commanders actions such as the off map 3" mortar and sending a runner to replenish ammo. Certain orders will make the chosen actions easier to execute and more successful. A Hold order for example will not allow a move action, although a regroup action is possible. A Recce order will allow you to spot easier and not to be spotted by the enemy as easily but will not allow you to enter into combat.

After the action phase has been completed for your platoon, a paragraph check is made. This will allow you to spot enemy units, buildings, bridges, be aware of any terrain modifiers within the hex. The level of awareness is attached to the actions and orders of your platoon. If you go charging around the map with an Assault order, don't be surprised to run into mines and wire and making the enemy aware of your position without spotting them in return as well as having less command over these units.

The VPs are directly connected to the number of turns it takes to complete the game. But do not get complacent as you are never sure what lies ahead until you have read that last paragraph.

Name: Flames of War: Avanti – Italian Forces in North Africa 1942-1943
Description:
The Italians learned about modern warfare the hard way in 1940. Now they are back, showing the world what the Italian soldier can do. Fighting under the famous 'Desert Fox', General Rommel, they form a crucial part of the Italian-German Panzer Army. Tough, determined, skilled, and aggressive veterans, the Italians broke through the British Gazala Line to save the trapped German Afrika Korps, held the line at El Alamein, and opened the way at Kasserine Pass, before holding up the American offensive at El Guettar. Fight or die for the new Roman Empire!

This book gives you a whole new way of fighting in the desert. The Italians are more lightly equipped, but more determined than the Germans and British. Their infantry is as numerous as the Americans, but more experienced.

—description from the publisher

Name: Oymyakon
Description:
Oymyakon, winter of 1926.

Oyamyakon is a semi-cooperative game where we will assume the role of a family from Oymyakon, the coldest inhabited city in the world. The purpose of the game is to survive the low temperatures and to be the family that has lived a winter in the best possible conditions, accumulating more and better resources, for this they must manage to put groups of 3 cards of the same type inside their house and get thus the highest number of victory points.

—description from the publisher

Name: All-American Gamers Guide
Description:
All American Gamers Guide (ASL Comp)

Final expansion of the "All American" series, the item crowns the trilogy by providing additional material to this highly detailed historical sequence. It is closely linked to the last issue "Shanley's hill".

28 page long, it contains:

     the designer's notes of Shanley's hill from Ian Daglish
     a new Campaign Game called "Night Drop"
     3 scenarios pitting 'old' Paratrooper scenarios into the real battlefield thanks to the accurate map provided
     a Solitaire mission "Group Able south!" using the three previously published maps
     and finally an interview of a famous veteran of those days, Robert Murphy.

Name: Iron and Blood: Easy Rules for Gaming The Franco-Prussian War 1870-71
Description:
Iron and Blood: Easy Rules for Gaming The Franco-Prussian War 1870-1871


     Doomed cavalry charges! 
     Rattling mitrailleuses blasting holes through ranks of spiked-helmeted Prussians! 
     The deadly accuracy of the Chassepot rifle vs. Krupp artillery! 


If you've ever wanted to game the Franco-Prussian War of 1870–71, but were put off by the steep entry cost, this might be what you're looking for.

This is a set of miniatures rules that are easy to learn, completely intuitive, and provide meaningful tactical options for players.

NOTE: This is not a campaign book or scenario book, just a system for running whatever historical or hypothetical battles of the period you please. Army lists are not included!

Minis: designed for 6mm but can be easily adapted

Turn Sequence:

     Place Orders
     Load Cannons
     Move Commanders
     Check Orders
     Move
     Melee
     Fire


—description from the publisher and rulebook

Name: Wars of Yor: Basics
Description:
Wars of Yor: Basics is a simplified wargame for two or more players with a Rock – Paper – Scissors style format.

Maneuver your armies' units and plan your attacks where you have the advantage.  
Calvary beats Infantry, Infantry beats Pikemen, and Pikemen beat Calvary.  
Archers plink at range, and die in close combat.

This title includes PDF rules, and STL files for 3D printing the units.

This set includes both full units, or, for those who want to save PLA, minimal unit bases.  
Both are the same size bases so you can play with either style, or mixed, with no rule changes.

This set has some custom dice STLs, but they are not needed for play.  
You can use regular D6s and consult the Advantage chart for results.  
The dice are designed in a way to allow for as much randomness as possible, but nothing beats a casino D6 for impartial rolling.

—description from the publisher

Name: Barrow Builders
Description:
You have been hired to build a henge atop a barrow within a single year, taking one turn for each month.  Using the runes to guide you, create different stone configurations and place them on the barrow mound.

There are three different types of placements: arches, standing stones, and round stones.  There are three different colors of stones: exotic blue, polished white, or common dark gray.

You play by pulling any of the 24 Elder Futhark runes out of a bag.  Each turn drawn two runes.  The first rune drawn determines the placement, while the second rune drawn determines the color.

There is a chart provided for using dice: one eight-sided die and one six-sided die, if the player doesn't have access to any runestones.

—description from the designer

Name: Bloodfields
Description:
All known dimensions of the multi-realm branch out from one place. The Bloodfields. Their endless plateaus contain blueprints of all the things that can be. But they come at a cost. The grounds require a never-ending offering of blood spilled in battle.

The first beings born off the Bloodfields had to keep them satiated through gory festivals of violence. Many have died and many have become powerful beyond comprehension, thus becoming Gods.

The Gods have then created other realms. Filled them with magic and creatures of all kinds. But with one selfish purpose in mind. To ensure a never-ending stream of the most valuable resource - blood.

Every war, every disagreement, and even the smallest quarrel between Gods is therefore settled on the Bloodfields. And Gods always bring the greatest warriors from their realms to remain invincible!

This world is driven by conflict.

Bloodfields feature dynamic and simple yet engaging gameplay. To keep things action-packed each skirmish takes up to 60 minutes and features a team of chosen ones on each side.

To make every Bloodfields experience truly unique, there is a wide range of scenarios that enhance the gameplay. Each scenario has its individual rules, dedicated terrain, and surprising events. It’s up to you to prepare the winning strategy for each occasion, whether it is an endless siege or escorting a deranged mage.

Name: Carpet Bocce
Description: For those of you who enjoy playing bocce ball, outdoors in the summertime, here is a way to play all year round in the comfort of your living room. This miniature version of bocce ball is a fun way to get the whole family involved in the excitement of seeing who can get closest to the pallino. On those cold winter days, or during the rain-soaked springtime, never worry about getting in a friendly game of bocce again. A fun family game of dexterity for 2-4 players.

Name: Waimea Wipeout Surf board Game
Description: The world's first realistic surfing board game. Featuring the surf photography of Brian Bielmann, the game board and box are covered with magazine quality surf photos, making looking at the game almost as enjoyable as playing it. Roll a 10-sided die and execute the take off, drop and tube of waves on the north shore of Hawaii. If you make it past the barreling tube, you can execute a variety of maneuvers to accumulate points in search of the perfect 10. Additional surf break charts are also available to localize your Waimea Wipeout experience (not included). This is the game for surfers...but not only for surfers. Waimea Wipeout educates even the most novice of fans about the essential elements of competitive surfing, while also giving the chance of victory to all players. Unique would be an understatement for this game !

Name: Paranauê
Description:
It is the end of the 19th century and Capoeira, Brazil's cultural heritage today, is unfairly prohibited by law. You are a Mestre in Capoeira and you are about to structure your own roda, but you still need to get some more members, instruments and teachings so that it is fully formed.

Collect materials to make your musical instruments, get parts of clothing to call members to your circle, use Capoeira strokes strategically to duel your colleagues, manage to introduce educational values â€‹â€‹and elevate your group's experience. And be very careful! You will not want the police to hit your capoeira circle making your objective more difficult.

Are you ready to be part of the most known and respected Capoeira group in the world?

In Paranauê, you are a capoeira master who is disputing with other circles which is the strongest and most influential.
Join new members, produce instruments, duel and teach your values! At the end of the game, the player with the most Victory Points will be the winner.

Players take their turns until a player reaches the score according to the number of players below:
2 players - 25 points
3 and 4 players - 30 points
5 players - 35 points
When any player reaches the stipulated score the game will end as soon as the first player's turn begins.

So everyone adds up their
a deal with:

     Victory Points - Your current score on the trail.
     Objective Card - reveal your objective card. If you are finished, count the points.
     Wheel members - Add the value of each member to the wheel.
     Musical Instruments - Add the value of each instrument on the wheel.

Name: JAMIT
Description:
JAMIT  is a new game with FILLIT components.
If you have one FILLIT set, you can play two different games!
Enjoy FILLIT & JAMIT!!

FILLIT : https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/262806/fillit

Push coins into game board from around like as pusher game.
You win when you get a certain number points as push coins out.
You should arrange your point coins to be advantageous.
This is very tactical and abstractry game.
You can enjoy this game with only FILLIT components.

—description from the designer

Name: Worldwide Football: Extension n°2
Description: An expansion for Worldwide Football including 6 new teams (Cameroon, Croatia, Netherlands, Portugal, South Korea, Uruguay) and 2 new Star abilities.

Name: World War One: A Miniature War Game
Description:
World War One is a miniature-based table top wargame aiming to recreate the battles that took place in the years 1914 – 1918, as well as in the early 1920s - such as the Polish – Bolshevik war of 1920-21

Smallest unit size in the game is the platoon.
Activation is done at the Company level.

Game is designed for 20mm (1/72nd)

Name: Corona Wars: Survival
Description:
It is now 2026 post corona and mutants roam freely and you are the last of humanity’s remnants. You and your followers fight to escape the planet by any means necessary. Compete against other
factions in a race for resources, weapons and to be the only one to escape in a colonization ship.

Components
â—    DNA Deck- These cards come in 4 values and 2 different colors(back). 2,3,4 and 5. The 2 and 5 pieces have red backs, while the 3 and 4 pieces have greenbacks.  Collecting these cards will help solve the molecular DNA crisis and create a cure for the COVID-Z21 virus. When any player accumulates a sum of 10 or more DNA, then the game can be won!
â—    Schematics Cards (52 card Deck) - Rare cards that will allow a faction to create a spaceship to escape the planet. Collect 15 schematics in order to win the game by leaving the rest of humanity behind in order to colonize the stars. Only 7 of these cards exist in the entire game!
â—    Survivor Deck - A deck of cards that have survivors in them. Each survivor has a unique ability which will improve your chances at surviving the epidemic. When all survivors are gone, game over! 
â—    Tools Deck - This deck holds items and tools that can be used to survive the Zombie Plague. This includes weapons, defense tools , resources , med kits and more.
â—    Threat Deck - Cards which feature various zombie threats and humanoid threats courtesy of the Illuminati. Defeat zombies to harvest valuable DNA, while you must contend with illuminati threats to survive!

Set Up

â—    Determine turn order amongst yourselves.
â—    Each deck should be shuffled well before the game begins. 
â—    Deal 5 cards from the Survivor deck to each player. In turn, each player should place their Survivor cards face up in front of them.
â—    Add the Schematics cards to the Tools Deck as well as the remainder of the Survivor Deck. Shuffle the new Tool Deck well.
â—    Each player should also now be dealt 3 cards from the Tools Deck. Place the remaining Tool Deck cards face down in the center of the play area.
â—    Place all of the remaining decks (Tool and Threat Decks) face down in the center of the playing area.

With this the game is ready to begin!

Rules

The purpose of the game is to collect a sum of 10 schematic cards, the first to do this wins. Players can choose to help or hinder each other during this process.

Alternatively, if any player manages to collect 20, DNA cards and to sacrifice 5 cards, the game will end!

You lose if:
1.    Another player collects a sum of 20 or greater DNA material.
2.    A player collects 10 schematics cards to complete the process of building an escape ship.
3.    You lose all survivors in your faction.

Collecting DNA Cards
Perhaps the easiest way to win is to collect DNA cards. Each has a value listed on it which denotes the value of the DNA within. Collect a sum of 20 or more to win. This can be done in four ways:

â—    You can defeat a zombie to collect 1 DNA card.
â—    You can obtain them through bartering with other factions (players).
â—    You can steal or syphon them from other players.

Turns and Turn Actions

Each player has several actions they can take during a turn. These determine how the game progresses and are listed below:

1.    Place a card in play. This varies based on type of card, but generally there are no limits to the amount of cards you can have / place in play throughout the duration of a game or in a single turn.

The exception to this is Survivor cards, of which you can only have a maximum of 10.
2.    Draw a Threat card. This must be done every turn. You will either need to resolve your battle or you will have the freedom to take one or more other actions. [See Battle Resolution]
3.    Sacrifice 2 cards to draw from the DNA Deck.
4.    Sacrifice 2 cards to draw from the Tools Deck.

Of these four potential actions, #1 and #4 have no limitation on the number of times they can be performed during a turn. #2 and #3 can only be performed once per turn.

Finally, the player must make sure they have no more than 6 cards of any type in their hand at the end of the round. If you have more than six cards in hand you must make a decision as to which you’d like to discard, or offer them to other players in order to make a deal.

Once a player has performed all four of, or the actions they desire to perform for that turn, turn order moves to the next person in gameplay. When it isn’t your turn there are a few things you can do as well.

1.    Barter with other players. This includes assisting them, or bribing them so that you don’t hinder them.
2.    Play cards against other players. This can come from your hand only, not previously active cards.

The game continues in this way until winning conditions are fulfilled by one faction player.

Name: Mighty Monsters: Queenie 1 – Chieftains
Description: The chieftains are joining their fellow monsters to raid King Edgar's treasury. Each chieftain has a special ability that if used at the right moment can increase the amount of loot a player can collect in that round.

Name: Inkalam
Description:
High in the mountains, the realm of Inkalam is known for its fertile cornfields, herds of vigorous llamas, and the beauty of the lacustrine cities. But it’s especially his messengers’ guild, the Chascis, which makes it so famous.
Inkalam's prosperity depends on the quality of the messages transmitted by the Chascis. You will have to ensure the messages get delivered during a long day, from dawn to sunset.

The first player rolls the 3 dice, chooses one and puts it aside. Then all other players can choose one of the values presented by the 2-remaining dice.

Each player writes the chosen value on one of the Messages located on a Road starting from an already circled Messenger. Then they have to circle the Messenger at the other end of the Road.

If all the Messages located on the Roads surrounding a Region contain consecutive numbers (not necessarily in order), the player cross off a box of the Resource of this Region on their Scoreboard, starting with the lowest value. The next time for this Resource, the player will cross off the next higher value. At the end of the game, for each Resources (Lacustrine City, Corn Fields, and Lamas Herd), each player adds the value of the last box crossed off and the Speed Bonus if checked. Then player add the other bonus/malus of the game.

When you write on a Solar Message, check the Clock which tracks the game length. Once a player has checked the 8th sun on their clock, the game ends !

Add values for surrounded regions and any applicable speed bonuses and compare your scores.

Inkalam comes with two solo variants.

—description from the publisher

Name: MadCash
Description:
In MadCash, players start with nothing but the shirts on their backs and race to accumulate wealth any way they can. There are several ways players can accumulate cash, including getting jobs and gambling, but the trick is getting it into their bank account before they lose it.

The game board is a racetrack complete with a shortcut and spaces designed to create action or force decisions on every turn. Players use dice to move around the board and acquire Jobs (and a subsequent salary), receive Emails, collect cash payouts, and perform variety of other actions. Everyone starts by using dice and can use cash they collect to invest in other forms of transportation which allow them to strategically use up to 3 dice each roll, this also increases their job salary and the frequency at which they get paid.

There is a deck of Email cards with corresponding email spaces on the board that subject the players to a variety of events good and bad including salary increases, bills, and cards with the power to hinder other players' progress. Once players collect cash, they try to land on an ATM space in order to deposit into their bank account. Until a player's cash is safely deposited into the bank, it is fair game and can be stolen by other players, or lost in several other ways.

MadCash can be played individually or as teams with goal of accumulating a bank balance of $50,000. Game duration can vary greatly because of the volatility and unpredictability of the game play.

The game is designed in the tradition of other financial race games like Monopoly and Parker Brothers Full House, but with more of a ruthless, backstabbing element with no player ever truly being out of the race until the game is over.

—description from the designer

Name: Went the Day Well?
Description:
Miniature Wargame Rules, set during VBCW or Very British Civil War, it is an alternative history where Edward VIII refuses to abdicate triggering a constitutional crisis which divides the nation and results in Civil war. As a result instead of going to war in Europe, the nation is facing a very British crisis.

Platoon to company level rules, designed for 28mm

Turn Sequence:

     Initiative phase,
     Random Event phase,
     Recovery phase,
     Movement phase,
     Shooting phase,
     Melee phase
Families: Game: VBCW – A Very British Civil War

Name: Empower Empathy
Description:
Join the Super Squad to Resolve Social Dilemmas by Defending the City of Empathropolis against the Evil Villain Goobi!

Received 7 major awards in the toy & game industry:
1. 2021 Board Game of the Year Award of Creative Child Magazine
2. Staff Fave Hot Diggity Award Winner 2021
3. Tillywig Brain Child Award
4. Family Choice Award 2021
5. 2022 Board Game of the Year Award of Creative Child Magazine
6. 2022 Mom’s Choice Silver Award
7. 2022 Taiwan Prime Silver Award

Endorsed by:

     California Association of Marriage Family Therapy
     U.S. Association for Play Therapy
     California Teachers Association
     Community College Association
     National Association for Bilingual Education
     California Association of Resource & Special Educators Plus
     Tri-Valley SELPA (Special Education Local Plan Area) 
     The Future of Mental Healthcare West


WHAT THIS GAME IS ABOUT:
The citizens of the city Empathropolis have been under heavy emotional duress ever since the villain Goobi has made the city sewers his new home, Apathalypse. 
 He goes about town casting spells of emotional confusion on otherwise everyday, normal situations.

Fortunately, Empathropolis has its very own team of superheroes to the rescue!

As members of the Super Squad, you are thereby summoned to patrol and restore the City back to peace.

As you chase Goobi around the city, various City Watch scenarios are unveiled as you identify as many emotions and appropriate responses are at play. You will gain powers to strengthen your emotional powers and use them to banish Goobi back to his sewers.

This cooperative game and Exploration Guidebook help children develop emotional awareness and empathy with a positive growth mindset by transforming them into superheroes with superpowers that can resolve any social dilemma.

Our Teaching Approaches:

     Step into 160+ unique City Watch Scenarios to be mindful with thoughts, feelings and actions 
     Master emotional awareness with 28 different feelings
     Sharpen communication skills through self-reflection with 80+ Power Up cards
     Exercise empathy every day with our easy-to-use evidence-based exploration guidebook
     Learn and practice important emotional and communication skills while having silly fun!


Our Board Game Design:

     Quick to set up
     Easy to learn
     Professional graphic designs
     Self-contained inbox storage for easy cleanup
     Extra Dense high-quality handmade game box for durability and keepsake
     Custom made Double-A Extra High-Density Premium 5-ply 2.5mm white cardboard for all game components 
     Printed with Soy Ink®
     100% environmentally friendly and recyclable


Playing the Game:

     Place all configurable City Blocks, Power Blocks, and Sewer Holes GRAY side up, RED side down in any slots on the board slots. Every single play will be different.
     All Superheroes start at the Start Block; Goobi, the villain is placed at the center circle of the board, his Sewer.
     Players spin to determine whether to move a Superhero or Goobi. Dice roll determines the number of steps to advance forward or the sewer number to emerge from. 
     If the spinner stops at either of the Superhero quadrants, the player may choose ANY Superhero game piece to move.
     Whichever city block the Villain lands on, flip over the City Block to RED. 
     When Superhero lands on a RED City Block, player must draw a City Watch™ Scenario Card to assess the situation by using the Feeling Cards and the Thoughts-Feelings-Actions prompt.
     After solving the scenario, the RED City Block can be turned back to normal - GRAY.
     If a Superhero lands on a Power Block, the player must draw a Power-Up™ Card and discuss the question on the card. After discussion, player keeps the Power-Up™ Card to: 


        1) Send Goobi back to Sewer, 
        2) Select to turn over any RED City Block back to Gray, or 
        3) Make Goobi stay in the sewer at its turn.

     If Goobi lands on a power block, it immediately goes back to its sewer.
     If BOTH superhero and Goobi lands on the same block: 


1) Superhero is thrown into the sewer, 
        2) The block turns RED, and 
        3) The rest of the super squad must use the Feelings Card deck (roll dice to determine how many feelings to select randomly) to act out. After the rescue, player rolls dice to determine which sewer hole the Superhero may emerge from.

To Win The Game:

     Strategize with the entire team of Super Squad to turn most, if not all, RED City Blocks back to Gray.
     All members of the Super Squad must pass the predetermined round (Start Block) to complete the mission.
     Keep the Villain in his sewer to cause the least damage to the City Blocks.
     Collect as many Power-Up Cards as you can to keep the Villain in his sewer and/or turn the Red city block back to gray.
     Identify as many Emotions as you can with each City Watch™ patrol.  


—description from the publisher

Name: Castaway Curse
Description:
You were passengers on a luxurious cruise en route for the Bahamas, but your ship has mysteriously capsized! Only a few survivors washed up on Prospero Island...

Each player takes on the role of an unfortunate castaway. You're trapped! The Ghost of Captain Dread Red has controlled and terrorized the island for hundreds of years. His curse keeps mortals imprisoned -- doomed to face torment until death.

Adapt quickly and develop your skills as a pirate to defeat him!

GAMEPLAY: Castaway Curse is a fast-paced, area control, shipwreck adventure game.

* Scavenge the island for resources (draw key and weapon cards) 
   * Raid areas of Prospero Island to earn doubloons.
   * Set booby traps to keep command and defend your areas against raiding rivals.
   * Complete Conquest Cards to advance your character and defeat Captain Dread Red.

The game is over once any player defeats the ghost of Captain Dread Red, but the player with the most doubloons wins the game!

Name: Bamse och häxans dotter: Guldjaktenspelet
Description:
Child game based on the movie swedish movie "Bamse och häxans dotter". Roll a die and collect gold from the lake. But watch out, Krösus Sork (the thief) wants to steal your gold.

On your turn you roll a dice and get either gold from the pond or diving equipment. If you are unlucky and hit the thief's symbol, you will lose gold. If you hit the "Bamses" symbol, he retrieves all the gold from the thief and gives it back to you. The first person to collect six gold dumplings wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Banditen!
Description:
"Banditen!" it is a tactical wargame covering two battles between Italian Partisans and forces of the R.S.I (Repubblica Sociale Italiana).

Tarnova is a simulation of the battle fought on 19-21 January 1945 at Tarnova della Selva, near Gorizia.

Gravellona Toce is a simulation of the battle fought on 12-14 December 1944 at Gravellona Toce, 110 km NE of Torino.

Name: ミックスジュースパーティー (Mix Juice Party)
Three Kingdoms, modern naval battles
Description:
Japan-China-Korea; Three Kingdoms Modern Naval Battles is a board simulation game that depicts the possible conflict between the Japanese Maritime Self-Defense Force, the Chinese Navy and the Korean Navy that could be fought in 202x.

In this simulation, each surface ship/submarine is one unit, and each unit has anti-ship, anti-air, anti-submarine power, and technical level. In addition, wide area anti-air power must be set for Aegis warship. The character of each individual ship and each weapon is reproduced.

As a result, various modern naval battles including ship-to-ship, ship-to-air, ship-to-submarine, air-to-submarine, and air-to-air combat are reproduced with a simple game system, enabling you to play a three-dimensional modern naval-air battle.

In addition to four introductory scenarios that can be played in a short period of time, a campaign scenario that requires a plan of operations combining surface, submarine, and aircraft units on a wide scale is also included.

198 counters
1 full map
Time scale: 16 hours to 3 days (depending on scenario)
Unit scale: 1 ship /Several aircrafts
Game area: West Japan Sea and East China Sea

Scenarios:
     ãƒ»Dokdo ship, sortie! (Introduction scenario: Japan vs Korea)
     ãƒ»Senkaku offshore carrier battle (Introduction scenario: Japan vs China)
     ãƒ»Jeju Island Defense War (Introduction scenario: China vs South Korea)
     ãƒ»Aircraft carrier Izumo (Introduction scenario: Japan vs ?)
     ãƒ»Sakishima Islands Campaign (Main scenario: Japan vs China)

(translated and adapted from publisher's Japanese description)


Issue game of Game Journal #74.

Name: Savage Core
Description:
Savage Core is a fast play, competitive set of skirmish rules set in a primal land of savage warfare where clans battle for survival. Mature readers only, mature themes of primitive warfare.

—description from the publisher

Name: At Lances Point: Army Lists
Description:
At Lances Point Army Lists contains:

     Early Imperial Roman 30 BC to 211 AD
     Dacians 82 BC to 106 AD
     Britons 54 BC to 117 AD
     Early Germans 113 BC to 238 AD
     Parthians 247 BC to 224 AD

Name: Brigadier '38: Army Lists – Part One: The Field Armies
Description:
Brigadier'38: Army Lists - The Field Armies

Covers:

     the Royalist field armies,
     the Anglican League brigades,
     BUF and Reactionary forces,
     Army of the Lord Protector and
     the People's Assault Columns
Families: Game: VBCW – A Very British Civil War

Name: Brigadier '38: Army Lists  – Part Two: Scotland, Wales, Independent and County Forces
Description:
Brigadier'38: Army Lists  – Part Two

This part covers

     Scotland (5 lists),
     Wales (3 lists),
     Independent and county forces including Cornwall, Wynd Grator and the SFF.
     Also some additional rules for guerilla actions.
Families: Game: VBCW – A Very British Civil War

Name: RUN: Villains & Vigilance
Description:
In this expansion to RUN: The Board Game, villains and fiends infiltrate the dungeon, causing randomized battles, whereby you and your team will have to properly balance your speed, strength and damage to overpower those who would stand between you and escape.
Players arm themselves with weapons and special impact cards to overcome their foes!
The villains are not intended to deal physical damage to the players; instead, they either slow or speed the allies, adding an additional element to the game.
Of course, any good expansion would not be complete without a new themed boss and maybe even a new ally to join the fray!

—description from the publisher

Name: Hall of the Hag Queen (fan expansion for Warhammer Quest)
Description:
Hall of the Hag Queen is a supplement to Warhammer Quest, the game of dungeon adventures in the Warhammer World. This adventure pack contains everything needed for your Warriors to battle the Dark Elves of Naggaroth as they search for gold and treasure. Apart from any special rules in this book, all the normal set-up and game rules for Warhammer Quest also apply to Hall of the Hag Queen.

Only a handful of brave adventurers will dare to explore the caverns lining the coasts of the Old World and even fewer would dare to set foot in a Black Ark. From the Sea of Claws to the Black Gulf, incursions from the Dark Elves of Naggaroth are frightening and frequent. And because of this, the area has become known as the ‘Slavery Coast’.

In the Hall of the Hag Queen, the Warriors will delve into some of the most volatile areas of the Old World as they search for the hideout of a Dark Elf warband, even boarding their dark, cavernous vessel. They will be thwarted by treacherous passageways and perilous caves in addition to monstrous creatures and devilish traps. Trampling through the caverns of the Hag Queen might be a death sentence at best and an eternity of torture at worst. The Warriors may find themselves prisoners aboard a Black Ark heading back to the Land of Chill to die a slow death as slaves or they may be the victims of ritual sacrifice by the Witch Elves and their blood used to bathe in. But if fate is kind it is possible that they could overcome all obstacles to do something extraordinary; perhaps vanquishing the Hag Queen herself! Will fortune favour the foolish?

CONTENTS:

Hall of the Hag Queen 85 page Rulebook

Floorplans:
1 Objective Room (Temple of Khaine)
1 Dungeon Room (Water Cave)
2 Corridors (Landing, Bottomless Pit)

Counters:
3 Skull Counters
3 Book Counters

Playing Cards:
4 Dungeon Cards
27 Event Cards
15 Treasure Cards
4 Special Cards

—description from the designer

Name: Ares VS Athena
Description:
This game was attached to the ioGioco 16 magazine

Peloponnesian War: Sparta and Athens face off in a clash.
Ares and Athena, patron deities of the two city-states, direct the strategies of their respective sides by communicating with the forces on the battlefield through the souls of the deceased warriors.
But this time, even the gods took the field ... and the clash will be more epic than ever!

In this game the armies of Athens and Sparta face each other. The pawns move on a squared battlefield.
But there is also another squared board, the realm of the dead, where the souls of warriors end up when they die on the battlefield.
Each turn a player moves one token into the realm of the living and one into the realm of the dead.
The position of the souls of the deceased warriors will determine the possible movements of the living warriors who fight together with the deities.

Name: Star Breach: Hunters
Description:
Hunters is a cooperative miniatures tabletop game, set in the sci-fi multiverse of Star Breach. While Hunters is a standalone game, the rules for the game expand upon the core mechanics and settings of the Star Breach tabletop game ruleset. Thus, the Star Breach core rules will be often referenced throughout this expansion. The main difference between this expansion and the original game is that Hunters shifts the gaming action of Star Breach from “player vs player” to “players vs game” in a cooperative (co-op) environment. In this rulebook, you will find rules and mission based scenarios for solo play, co-op play up to four players, a campaign system, and a “GM” alternate mode where one of the players—or a 5th additional player—may play as the “game master” against their peers.

As with Star Breach, Hunters is a free ruleset allowing players to creatively play with any sci-fi models and within any scifi setting of their choosing. The industry standard of 28-32mm height models and gaming accessories are recommended for play, but the game will do just as well in any other popular gaming scale (such as 15mm). However you choose to use this expansion and the contained rules, I hope you and your gaming group have an absolute blast doing so! Enjoy, and keep your eye on the stars!

—description from the designer

Name: Bolt Action: Campaign – Gigant
Description:
Operation Sea Lion has proceeded, both sides have lost a lot and as a result the remainder of the German forces have been pushed to Kent where they prepare their defences against the inevitable British attack. The German high command refuse to let their blitzkrieg falter at this stage and concoct a brave, audacious and completely unexpected plan...

Operation Gigant is phase two of the theoretical plan to invade Britain that has been brought forward and into action as phase one falters!

Glider borne troops and vehicles are bought in to create a surprise second front in North East England, splitting the British defences still further and driving a steel wedge down through the heart of the British countryside!

Packed with new units to defend (or destroy) Britain's defences, new scenarios on what could of been historical battles, re-construct your whole army with new theatre selectors and more off-the-wall special rules dedicated to the scientific wonders created to invade, and defend, Britain!

This time however, the Panzerbrigades will leave their treads within the mud of the British countryside and over the rubble of humble villages. With the Germans coming into Britain once again but with their complete force, can the British and the remaining Allies hold the Germans off again? Or will the German war machine repeat their success in France and steamroll over Britain?

—description from the publisher

Name: Confrontation: Ram Army Book
Description: Supplement for Confrontation: the Age of the Rag'narok that contains additional rules for playing with the Ram (Undeads) Army and its associated artifacts, miracles and spells.

Name: The Art of War: The Card Game
Venedig
Description:
Before the game beginns, the canals are filled with water. The Movement of the tourists is determined by a spinner with possible results of 3 to 8. Other possible results are "K" (draw an action card) and "B" (place or move a bridge). If a tourist gets on a numbered space, he collects the picture postcard of this number.

The first player to collect 8 different picture postcards wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Tilt and Tournament
Description: A two player chess or checkers variant where each player has ten pieces -- two knights and eight attendants.

Name: The Bee-Hive of Fun
Description: A game of forfeits for up to 12 players (minimum 3). Includes various props: cardboard glasses, a fool's cap, and old lady's cap, and labels to be worn on the head. Movement with dice and dice-cup.

Name: Crispino
Description: Two to four players each have their own dice and dice cup and maneuver around a square board with multiple forks and windy paths. Each player has three pawns and one king.

Name: Stella
Description: A parcheesi variant.

Name: Chancery
Description: A race game for four players. Each player uses four counters, two dice, and a dice cup.

Name: On The Clock
Description:
On The Clock is a game about surviving corporate BS. The goal is to avoid as much work as possible while trying to get paid when it's most advantageous. If too much work is accrued, the player suffers burnout and is out of the game. Conversely, if the player makes enough money, they get to retire. The first to retire or last to burnout wins.

Each player takes turns drawing a card from the Event pile. The event card describes some BS the player is not on the hook to handle and how much work that Event will take. However, the player starts with Escape cards at their disposal. The Escape cards will help the player get paid for the work, pass it to another player or reduce the level of effort. If the work is passed, the recipient of the work can either counter the work with their own Escape card or just save their cards for a rainier day.

—description from the designer

Name: Seize the Power
Description:
Go to school to be educated. Get a job. Get money. Buy food and shelter.

Meanwhile, money is also used to gain power. Whoever wins a rule-auction can decide to enforce that rule – or not – as they wish. Players are free to make threats, or ask for bribes in exchange for preferential treatment.

The world itself is unfair. Those who have fewer arms, eyes, or no eye-stalks will be discriminated against. Their starting position will be worse – usually with less money and education – and rules in-game will also disadvantage them.

It is possible for the most disadvantaged character to win – of course it is! – but only if they work harder, smarter, and better than anyone else. Work together. Exploit every single mistake made by the strongest characters. Rely on some goodwill.

By contrast, the most advantaged characters can enjoy ‘stamping down’ on everyone else.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mystic Monkeys
Description:
Welcome to the jungle! Mystic Monkeys is a fast paced, easy to learn two-player showdown.  You and your opponent will play as rival monkey clans. Take turns using mind control powers to move your opponent’s monkeys and harvest the mystical powers that the jungle has to offer. Outwit your opponent in battle by using combat tiles earned during the game. Your objective will be to strand or capture all of your opponent’s monkeys. If on your turn you cannot move any of your opponent’s monkeys, you are crowned king of the Jungle… or at least what is left of it!

Happy gaming! 
-Patrick & Jeffrey- co-designers

Name: Army Men: Card Combat
Description:
Army Men: Card Combat is a dirt simple, two player wargame that’s playable with only a handful of plastic Army Men and a pack of standard playing cards.

The game was designed with kids in mind and is a great way to introduce your younglings to the world of wargaming. 
In pursuit of this goal, the game is built on a simple foundation drawing on the classic card game, War, with the addition of figures and movement. 
Several optional advanced rules are then presented throughout to add more strategy as players become comfortable with the rules such as Cover, Stats, and Special Abilities.

Army Men: Card Combat also offers a low cost, fast playing wargame option for all ages if you just want a casual, beer-and-pretzels experience that hits all the right nostalgia notes.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel Avengers Hero Rush Game
Description:
Any fan of the superheroes in the Marvel universe will love this fast-paced board game featuring Hulk, black Panther, and Iron Man. It's going to take speedy moves and fast thinking to be the ultimate hero in this game. Move hero timers from one flip zone to another as directed by your villain move cards. Don't let the sand run out on your turn. Get a hero right or hero left card without a timer running out and you score an Avengers token. Three tokens and you score a victory! Features three plastic figures with sand timers—black Panther, Iron Man, and Hulk! Recommended for two to four players, ages six and up.

—description from the publisher

Name: Super Dungeon: Masterclass – Chuy and Apprentice
Description:
Blasting their way south from Arcadia alongside Steelhorse Candy, Chuy and his misfit sidekick, known only as The Apprentice, have an uncommon knack for stirring up trouble. The minions of the Dark Consul have become obsessed with The Apprentice's capture. No doubt they are drawn to the young Apprentice Mage's unique connection to the magics of Crystalia.

Chuy and Apprentice are Limited Edition miniatures that can be used in your games of Super Dungeon and Rail Raiders Infinite!

CONTENTS:
1x Chuy Masterclass Miniature
1x Apprentice Mage Masterclass Miniature
1x Chuy Hero Card
1x Chuy Rail Raiders Infinite Card
1x Apprentice Mage Hero Card
1x The Apprentice Rail Raiders Infinite Card.
2x 25mm Black Bases

Take your Super Dungeon hobby to the next level with Super Dungeon: Masterclass! This premium line of resin models is specifically designed for hobby enthusiasts and gamers alike! Featuring Heroes and monsters from throughout the realms of Crystalia, these finely detailed miniatures bring the world of Super Dungeon to life as never before. Description:
A major otaku and video game enthusiast, Jun is no stranger to cosplay and loves attending conventions dressed as her favorite characters. She is always drawn to adorable witches, such as the Sanctioned Witch, and their lovely, pointy hats.

Name: Super Dungeon: Masterclass – Witch Exterminator
Description:
The sprawling metropolis of Areals at the heart of Clockwork Cove is a twisting labyrinthine city of technological wonder and ceaseless change. As new structures are built upon the old, less savory denizens begin to fill the abandoned districts and subterranean depths of the city. When infestations of chimeric rats, undercover goblins, and malfunctioning clockworks grow too large Witch Exterminators are called in cull their numbers and maintain the safety of the city.

Description:
With her commanding presence, Citrine found her calling as a warrior and general. She possesses a keen insight for battlefield maneuvers, and her boisterous and bawdy personality ingratiated her immediately with the soldiery. Joining her father on many campaigns, her mere presence serves as a rallying cry to the soldiers of Crystalia and her strength at arms turns many a battle in the King’s favor.

Description:
Sometimes, the dead cannot rest. Onryo died in terror, in rage, and in great pain. Now, she torments any travelers who come near, or those who remind her of the family that murdered her. Far too many have followed her distant, phantom figure flickering between trees and joined her small bones in a black and lonely pool.

Onryo is an all-new Dungeon Boss from the realm of Kagejima!

Description:
Few types of death spectre inspire such dread as Kagejima's shinigami. These deadly spirits lure victims into cursed pacts, offering up knowledge or power that inevitably leads to an unfortunate death. Indeed, so insidious and cruel are these pacts that many seek death in order to end the suffering their bargain causes.

Shinigami is an all-new Mini-Boss from the realm of Kagejima!

Hanzo has been called many things over his long and storied life: master, teacher, monster. His team won the Moonlight Tournament twenty-two years ago through legendary speed and infamous cunning. He displayed all these qualities in the Sun Empire, but added another—treachery—for the first and only time, a Kagejima shinobi decided to stay with the Sun Court.

Name: Excavation Earth: Second Wave
Description:
Second Wave is the first expansion for Excavation Earth, introducing two new races - the Collectors and the Influencers - along with new game-play elements and ways of scoring. The Observation Barge, which lets you further manipulate the market demand for artifacts and score points at the end of the game. Achievements add a whole new way of scoring by completing set goals and Racial Wildcards give each race their own, more powerful action card to boost their round!

—description from the publisher

Name: Super Dungeon: Masterclass – Goemon
Description:
Few people have actually met Ishikawa Goemon, but almost everyone knows his name, either from fireside tales or wanted posters. Though a hunted man, Goeman has fought in the last three Moonlight Tournaments, daring authorities to arrest him. None have tried, and this has only emboldened him.

Description:
For years, people from every walk of life have employed or assisted this pleasant, helpful man. He has worked as a chef, a healer, a tutor, a masseur, and more. Few people know that the exploitative landlords, corrupt magistrates, bandit leaders, and gangsters left maimed, ruined, or slain in his wake owe their demise to this humble man.

Name: Counting Sheep: Stubborn Shepherd
Description:
Once upon a time, there was an old stubborn shepherd, named Todd. He had a strange habit. Every morning before the sheep went grazing, he would sort the sheep by their number. Todd had a special way to make sure all the sheep were in the correct order, but as he got older and older, he would sometimes make mistakes. Can you help him put all the sheep in the right order ?

Counting sheep ( Stubborn shepherd ) is a cooperative, limited communication deduction card game from TRANSit Studio.
Each turn player will play a sheep card face down to the sequence in the middle of the table, each sheep card has a unique number ( from 2 to 38 ) and a hint about the number on the back of the card, players win if all the sheep is in numerical order at the end of the game.

Name: Super Dungeon: Masterclass – Gork the Hearthsworn Fighter
Description:
This Limited Edition Gork the Hearthsworn Fighter Masterclass Miniature features Gork the Hearthsworn Fighter, the hero of the Super Dungeon Novel, The Dungeons of Arcadia.

Resilient and unflinching in the face of combat, the Hearthsworn Dwarves are warriors without peer. Able to withstand injury that would fell any of the lesser races, the Hearthsworn cleave through their adversaries bellowing insults and challenges to any foolish enough to face them.

CONTENTS:
1x Gork the Hearthsworn Fighter Masterclass Miniature
1x Gork the Hearthsworn Fighter Hero Card
